ygData.subject: Re: Spoilers
ygData.msgSnippet: Famous Camp Killers: Giants Sand Giants Griffons Jaezebel Bladesong, Gypsy bard of the 19th Stanza, Inouruuk ... From: G2 Dan  To:
ygData.messageBody:
Famous Camp Killers:

Giants
Sand Giants
Griffons


Jaezebel Bladesong, Gypsy bard of the 19th Stanza,
Inouruuk
-----Original Message-----
From: G2 Dan <drockwell@...>
To: eqbards@onelist.com <eqbards@onelist.com>
Date: Friday, June 18, 1999 1:27 PM
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Spoilers


>From: "G2 Dan" <drockwell@...>
>
>
>Well said! Seems we do have quite a few Bards on this list. I've found EQ
>extremely addictive as well so keep the info flowing. My character isn't
>power hungry or camp hungry like many of the players I've seen lately. I'm
>much more into the part of being a bard and enjoying the fantasty world. I
>detest the idea of hanging out waiting for things to respawn for you to
kill
>and then wait to kill again. I really think EQ needs a rogue band of camp
>killers to go around and whack on people if they've been sitting there for
>too long. I do think we bards get left out sometimes though. I think we
>need to have a concert or something, maybe a Bard-alapooza or show. Gather
>the bards together and sing baby sing!
>
>Gediprime, of Xegony
>
>
>----- Original Message -----
>From: Bob Stewart <bstewart@...>
>To: <eqbards@onelist.com>
>Sent: Friday, June 18, 1999 12:05 PM
>Subject: [eqbards] Spoilers
>
>
>> From: Bob Stewart <bstewart@...>
>>
>> At 12:52 PM 6/18/99 -0400, John Robertson wrote:
>> >Spoilers below... though not many.
>>
>> It is good that those supplying information some will consider spoilers
>> should give such warning. That said, I'll offer my take on this forum
and
>> spoilers.
>>
>> I play EverQuest way too much. Since I got it I no longer vegetate in
>> front of the TV. I play. Hmmmm. Maybe overall that is an improvement.
>:-)}
>>
>> Anyway, even playing that much there's a lot I miss due to time or don't
>> figure out or am a bit too careful about. In my mind and on an in-game
>> basis, this forum represents a conclave of bards, helping one another.
>I'm
>> a dedicated roleplayer, trying to keep the fantasy intact as much as I
can
>> and avoiding fantasy-busters such as /loc or talking too much in terms of
>> software mechanisms, but I'm sure in an alternate reality like our game
>> world bards would share tales and information, suggesting good places to
>> see, profitable ventures, and particularly effective techniques and
>equipment.
>>
>> Some want to discover it all for themselves. Some want the most power
the
>> fastest. Some want to live a fantasy life. I want to have fun and avoid
>> major frustration and I find this forum a wonderful resouce to those
ends.
>>
>> Bob
>>
>> Keep the information flowing. It is the life blood that runs through the
>> veins of the bards, the heart and soul of Norrath.
>>
>> Thrush, human bard of the 14th circle, Freeport, Veeshan aspect
>>
>>

>>
>
